Name: Paul G.
AboutMe:
While studying geography at the university of Leipzig, he participated in five scientific studies three for the Saxon Ministry of State for Education and Culture, one for the city of Leipzig and one in cooperation with the RWI Essen for the German Federal Ministry of Economic Affairs and Energy. Through various projects and teaching at the Institute of Geography, he gained additional in depth expertise with geographic information systems. After gaining the master’s degree in anthropogeographics in 2013 he started to work as a research scientists at the Institute for Infrastructure and Resource Management (IIRM) until 2015.

His work at the IIRM focused on model development for invest decisions. He was vice project manager and lead developer for an operation research based investment decision model regarding heat and electricity generation in the industrial sector. In a second project he lead developed an agent-based model for private investments in renovation of buildings at the scale of small municipalities as part of “Energy Efficiency City of Delitzsch”.
